page.title: 16Local Employment
page.content: Although the Prison is the largest employer of labour in the village there are several other occupations. Six people work for the Plymouth Water Authority maintaining the local water supply and leats. Five work for the Duchy of Cornwall. Several work in the school and some in a near-by quarry or in forestry. Others are self-employed or work in small workshops provided by COSIRA in Duchy buildings in the village or in out-buildings at Tor Royal farm. There is seasonal work in the local gift shops, hotels and cafes. Others commute to Plymouth and Tavistock.
